In Wisconsin: cosmetologists are required to undergo at least 1,550 hours of training at a licensed cosmetology school, which equates to about 39 weeks if assuming 40 hours per week.
Alternatively: aspiring cosmetologists can choose to complete a two to four-year apprenticeship, consisting of at least 4,000 hours of practical training and theoretical instruction.
Cosmetologists must also pass a practica: which can take up to 6.5 hours in total, in order to obtain a license.
On the other hand: police officers in Wisconsin undergo a 21-week training program, which includes various assessments such as a medical assessment, background check, and drug test. Additionally, officers are required to have an associate's degree within their first five years of service, although it may be permitted to be completed within this timeframe.
